comment: The all-zero vector is contained in the finite hull, since its support is empty and therefore finite. This theorem along with the next one effectively proves that the finite hull is a "submonoid", although that does not exist as a defined concept yet. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 11-Jan-2015.)
